title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 145-1.13 - Retroactive effective date
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 145-1.13 - Retroactive effective date

State Regulations

If the recipient of an academic performance award shall, during the academic year preceding the effective date of such award, have been
enrolled as a full-time matriculated student in a program of study that can be
approved for such award, then the effective date of the award shall be
considered as the beginning date of such approved study, and all benefits and
requirements applying to such award shall be considered applicable in the same
manner as if the award had been made originally on such effective date. However, the following awards shall be excluded from the provisions of this
section: Regents physician shortage scholarships, Regents scholarships for
professional study of osteopathy and Empire State Challenger scholarships and
fellowships for teachers. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
§§
145-1.13

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
